content:
Professor Lathrop:

While writing my project I wrote a small Tournament framework in Java
that I used to compare different Players and Strategies. I took some
extra time to document it and I want to share it, since I think that
maybe next generations could benefit from it (at least as reference for
those without much coding experience).

I have attached the necessary files to execute it. The file
test/connectNTest/GameTest.java contains the main method and shows how
to execute the framework.

Essentially, a specialization of the class Player in "src/players" can
represent any kind of player, and then can be called in GameTest.java to
play against other kinds of player (including human). At the end of a
tournament a short summary of time and results is print to standard
output.

Hope it will be useful somehow.

Thank you.

David Carrillo
